AI Description: NAMD (NAnoscale Molecular Dynamics) is a parallel molecular dynamics code designed for high-performance simulation of large biomolecular systems. It is developed by the Theoretical and Computational Biophysics Group at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.
Core Features: High-Performance Simulation Of Large Biomolecular Systems, Parallel Computing Support, Integration With Vmd For Visualization, Scalability To Utilize Supercomputers, Efficient Handling Of Systems With Millions Of Atoms
